p: Recently, the prediction of effect of climate change on health aspects has been widely studied [ 18, 19]. Prediction of an infectious disease such as cholera by reliable modeling can help managers to perform preventive actions such as preparation of adequate manpower, pharmaceutical and logistic resources [ 20]. Artificial neural networks (ANNs), as nonlinear statistical modeling, can be applied for creating models of disease spreading and prediction of epidemic outcomes. Moreover, ANNs can gain elucidation of data and nonlinear forecast analysis of variables for evaluation of biological and environmental data [ 21]. Several studies applied ANNs to forecast the incidence of cholera over an area and illustrated advantages and disadvantages of this method [ 21, 22].
